title: South Samoa Family-Owned Beachfront Oasis with Daily Breakfast, Nightly Drink & A$150 Dining Credit
description:
The glimmering beachfront of this resort - made famous by the 1950s Hollywood classic of the same name - is the stuff of dreams. Let lush palms and white sands whisk you away, all as you enjoy the warm hospitality of this family-owned hideaway, hosted by the same custodians of the land for over 1,000 years.

Onsite eateries cater your stay on Samoa's south island - a poolside cafe with international favourites and the signature restaurant with fresh local seafood. You're also invited to cool off with tiki drinks at Rock Pool Bar, housed in a traditional Samoan hut, and relax at the Lomi Wellness Spa or by any of the four pools.

Your stay on Upolu Island includes a two-hour village tour, taking you to all of the filming locations from the 60-year-old movie, sharing insights into old traditions and visiting a local primary school to introduce you to the charm of local life.

title: Samoa Beachfront Island Retreat with Gourmet Dining, Massages & Roundtrip Airport Transfers
description:
Between Samoa’s lush coconut groves, magnificent cascades and volcanic peaks is where you will find Sinalei Reef Resort & Spa, a slice of boutique beachfront paradise sheltered within a sky-blue lagoon on the south coast of Upolu Island. Discover barefoot luxury surrounded by countless acres of tranquil gardens and ageless Samoan hospitality. It’s the perfect base to discover the island’s countless wonders - including swell-blessed surf beaches, whirling all-day marketplace Maketi Fou and the world-famous To-Sua Trench, an iridescent swimming hole blue beyond compare.

After days spent beneath the Samoan sun, return to onsite ‘Ava I Toga Restaurant for organic South Pacific fusion under the stars, sip coconut mojitos poolside at Uncle Harry’s Bar take a swing at the resort’s nine-hole golf course. For those looking for the ultimate in island indulgence, head to Tui-I-Lagi Spa for traditional treatments utilising the island’s bountiful local produce - including papaya, lemongrass and more.

title: Island Paradise in Samoa
description: Get a true taste of Samoa with an escape to Le Vasa Resort on the island of Upolu. This Polynesian paradise consists of just 16 bungalows, villas, beach fales and rooms, and offers a range of authentic Samoan experiences, including cultural activities and delicious local food. Your escape includes a daily tropical breakfast, one happy-hour cocktail per person, a Samoan cultural activity and more.
offer_address: Main West Coast Rd., Cape Fatuosofia, Apolima - Uta, Samoa

title: Blissful Samoa Island Escape with Decadent Dining
description:
Uncover a slice of tropical paradise where azure waters lap fine, white sands, staying in a luxurious beachfront oasis: Sinalei Reef Resort & Spa - a child-free paradise nestled within a sheltered lagoon on the south coast of the Samoan island of Upolu. Discover breathtaking natural beauty closeby, including the postcard-perfect To-Sua Trench sinkhole - an Instagrammer's dream with its aquamarine pool framed by verdant hanging greenery - waterfalls and sliding rocks, not to mention excellent surfing.

Experience the ultimate island escape and indulge with daily tropical breakfast and daily afternoon tea, a two-course dinner, a Saturday BBQ buffet dinner, an à la carte lunch during your stay, a 30-minute massage per person, a welcome drink on arrival, a signature cocktail each and convenient return airport transfers. Plus, discover more of Samoa’s rich culture with a visit to a local village included in your package.

⏱**Buy now, book later**: Secure this deal now and choose your travel dates when you're ready (see Fine Print for details).

title: South Samoa Family-Owned Beachfront Resort with Daily Breakfast, Nightly Drink & A$150 Dining Credit
description:
Made famous in the 1950s film of the same name, the glimmering beachfront of Return to Paradise Resort is the stuff of Hollywood dreams. Let lush palms and white sands whisk you away, all as you enjoy the warm hospitality of this family-owned hideaway, hosted by the same custodians of the land for over 1,000 years.

Two eateries cater your stay on Samoa's south island - a poolside cafe with international favourites and the signature restaurant with fresh local seafood. You're also invited to cool off with tiki drinks at Rock Pool Bar, housed in a traditional Samoan hut, and relax at Sparadise Day Spa with massages fueled by ancient oils.

Your stay on Upolu Island includes a two-hour village tour, taking you to all of the filming locations from the 60-year-old movie, sharing insights into old traditions and visiting a local primary school to introduce you to the charm of local life.
